div.div: Collegiate Hall - College Preparatory Charter School

div.p:
Address: 1142 E. 56th St.
Tulsa OK 74105
Phone: 918.925.1620
Email: contactus@collegiatehall.org

p.a: OUR MISSION IS TO PREPARE EVERY STUDENT FOR COLLEGE.

div.p: Collegiate Hall educates students in grades 4-8 for acceptance to, persistence in, and graduation from college.
Equipped with a strong academic foundation and clear moral compass, Collegiate Hall graduates rise above life's challenges to lead on campus, in their communities, and throughout their careers.
Sharing and celebrating our students, our families, and our faculty through social media!
To empathize with others and to demonstrate caring in our daily lives.
To act thoughtfully and morally in the face of adversity and to stand up for what you believe in.
To always put forth your best effort and to relentlessly pursue your dreams and goals, regardless of obstacles.
To be able to be depended upon and to take continuous ownership for your work, thoughts, and actions.
To maintain a constant sense of dignity and to uphold the value of others or objects through your words, actions and attitude.
To be truthful, fair, and trustworthy and to remain true to your principles and commitments.
Members of the Collegiate Hall community know there are three things that will help us rise above life’s challenges to be successful:

1. We work as hard as possible to improve, each and every day.
2. We believe we can do it, and support each other to do so.
3. We strive to live our core values – respect, integrity, responsibility, courage, perseverance, and compassion – every day and in every interaction.
In doing so, we build the skills, habits, and character necessary to become leaders of our school and our community.
Dear Friends and Supporters of Collegiate Hall,
The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.

That journey – acceptance to, persistence in, and graduation from college for every Collegiate Hall student – started in 2014, with the decision by the Tulsa Public School Board of Education to authorize Collegiate Hall to educate students in the community around 61st and Peoria. As we enter 2015, we continue working towards one goal: establishing Collegiate Hall Charter School, a public, college preparatory charter school that provides students – regardless of their race, gender, or socioeconomic status – the intelligence and...
Parents and community members are the greatest support for the work we do. Sign up here to receive updates throughout the school year!

input.name: signup[activity_is_private]
input.input: Don't publish this on the website

div.div: INTERESTED IN ENROLLING YOUR STUDENT? CLICK HERE

div.p: Collegiate Hall provides all students a rigorous, college preparatory curriculum in order to prepare them for advanced coursework in high school and for college graduation.
The goal of the Collegiate Hall Reading Department is to create a life-long reader out of each student. Students...
Students at Collegiate Hall build their math skill in four key areas:
1. Students will build their fluency and flexibility...
Students will approach a learning of American history and regional geography through content literacy, and especially through textual and...
There are two big things that set STEM at Collegiate Hall apart. The first is that we teach computer...
Collegiate Hall Scholars will develop a curiosity and desire to explore the world around them. Students will build a solid...
Collegiate Hall’s students, families and teachers are grateful for the generous support of the Tulsa community. Our work would not be possible without their support!

div.p: Contact us at:

Address: 1142 E. 56th St.
Tulsa OK 74105
Phone: 918.925.1620
Email: contactus@collegiatehall.org

div.div: Sign in with Facebook, Twitter or email.
Please send us any questions or feedback you may have and we will contanct you in return. Thanks.
